segments.text: Hey, boss, I think she's waking up.
Any chance to get her bearings, Bradley?
Oh my god, I can't move.
The chair stirrups are designed to let you squirm.
What do you want from me?
But, babysitter, the problems you've been causing are bigger than you know.
Thin Kinkle can't let that happen.
You're gonna kill a helpless girl strapped in a chair?
Hoping you'll walk out of here, believe it or not, but justice has got to be served.
You want to see another birthday, you have got to get educated.
Don't know why I'm taking you under my wing like this, but a guy gets the urge to pass on his life lessons.
Uh, are you sure about that?
I gotta use it on you!
Made him on crystal way back when, clamped right here on your head.
The knife's like a pop quiz from hell.
But what you say doesn't matter to the knife.
Anytime you think bad thoughts about Thin, the knife is gonna hurt you.
Only way to stop the pain is to surrender.
Don't imagine you break easy so you're in for a rough ride.
I'm not so great on homework, Thin, but I do pretty well on the tests.
People tell me you can beat the quiz, but I warn you now, there's no beating this thing.
It knows what you're thinking about, Thin.
Try not to think about you at all, Thin.
Nice he's worried about you, sweetheart.
You better pray he never finds you.
It's meet the teacher night, baby sir.
Thin, all these bad thoughts are hurting us both.
That goes for the curfew, Erla.
Daddy's here to pick you up.
You always best sometimes, you took out one of my net.
You hurt her, and I will make you beg for death.
Oh, I believe you're the one who just fell in the Thin Kinkles basement.
Believe you're the one tied up in buck mesh on Thin Kinkles' floor.
I want you to love me.
Look at that, he's tearing the mesh!
I need you so, Sonari, for this little, cute little question.
See, you and Daddy both go for the scrappy dog routine.
Works when you're the biggest and the baddest.
Touching, but do you know who I am?
Maybe now you get it, Princess.
Bradley, every time she comes to, give her the knife.
When she stops crying, she's done.
Crawling back into the world all flush with love of Thin.
I mean, she might be here a while.
Mick, I need you to help me clean up a mess.
If she dies in the chair…
People would just keep their business and do what they're told, no one would ever get hurt.
Jersey, I need to talk to you about something.
Well, tell me you're having an affair.
Of course I'm not having an aff…
Yeah, some good looking piece of anti-missile defense code, I bet.
Hey, Toots, you're a thermoresistant casing or mine?
Are you still torturing that auditor?
I don't know, I haven't been paying attention.
Oh, seven more parking tickets this week.
You want nothing left of your enemy but a skull nailed to a fence post so everybody understands the cost of crossing you.
Jesus, what's gotten into you today?
On Friday a voice just started playing inside me.
I can't remember ever hearing him before.
But if you heard his voice, doesn't that mean you've been surveilling him?
But you didn't know you were doing it?
What if spying hasn't been the only thing I've been doing in my sleep?
What if I've been rigging elections or bankrupting third world nations?
You couldn't do that, could you?
I am a very resourceful girl, Jersey.
What if you were that thing that brought the ship crashing out of the slipstream?
Durga, what the hell is going on with you?
It's like I have this whole left hand and my right hand doesn't know what it's doing.
Something that has to do with this new voice and the CP crash and whatever is happening on Chala Base.
Look, it doesn't take a genius to figure out you were some kind of military program, Durga.
Maybe we should turn you over to the Navy.
I need to figure out who my enemy is before I walk into any rooms with my hands up.
Why can you hear this new voice you weren't supposed to hear?
It's like someone unlocked it to me.
Can you still follow the other guys you were surveilling?
I haven't been paying much attention.
They're getting rid of the body right now.
I can do better than that.
Now shut your lock and blow this guy over.
You guys couldn't have done it neater?
Look at this blood, it's everywhere.
There were five guys out there.
Whoever the hell you are, when Finn finds out, he's gonna…
Yes, initial that you've seen them, would you?
A diplomatic post in New Mombasa.
I know that I didn't always…
Not like when I was coming up.
I'm sorry if I wasn't up to standards.
It'll do more for your career than this one would.
You need someone in New Mombasa.
Kind of late to represent me?
I don't think you want me there to work.
Not if I'm officially attached to Intel.
You like your mole small and innocuous.
I will remind you that that information is not for idle speculation.
Maybe you've got a new protege.
Ronnie's going to stay where she is.
Now I have work to do and you, I'm sure, need to make some arrangements.
I am up to my Adam's apple and paperwork and you owe me quite a bit of it.
Surveillance analysis on Callisto since you mention it.
You know, my mother is ill.
I could request compassionate dispensation to stay here where I'm close to her.
I'll have you investigated for malingering if you even try such a stunt.
So you want me out of here?
I have enjoyed working with you young man, but I am not sentimental.
And don't think I won't eat you alive if you start playing games with me.
I got another letter from Nick.
No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.
Oh god, they stopped at Beth's cubicle.
Collingwood, I regret to inform you your husband, Keith Collingwood, was killed in action off-reach last month.
The Navy wants you to know he fought bravely, and his sacrifice will not be in vain.
One soldier means wounded and two means…
Oh, I thought it was Nick.
I thought they had come to tell me it was Nick.
They wouldn't come to tell me anyway.
I don't have that kind of claim, do I?
Come back home, just for the weekend.
Life is too short to keep running home, Sarah John.
Somebody was coming to kill me last week, and I'm going to find out why.
Hold on, someone's at the door.
I had this idea the other day.
Well, I got here and I thought it wouldn't be polite just to barge in.
I have more funny colored poker chips than any other colonial in town.
Stop by the casino and I'll buy you 400,000 drinks with little umbrellas.
Oh, there's that madcap sense of humor.
Look, I've got this killer opportunity here.
How's that different from being a doctor?
No residency, no board exam, no license.
What did I ever do to you?
Why am I the lab rat for all your crazy ideas?
I don't think of you as a lab rat.
I feel bad for you sometimes.
Oh, man, it's a good one.
So, you gonna let me in?
So, I'm watching this celebrity of the week thing last night and a thought occurs to me.
I already said goodbye to you, right?
How much appearance money could you soak up if there was more than one of you?
Burn bright, be everywhere, ride the wave until it falls on you.
See where I'm going with this?
You're going to invent a way to see the future so you can clone the people who are going to be celebrities?
Come for a ride with me.
Anyone wishing to exit at Capitol City, please listen carefully.
Hey, what do you think you're…
No, I mean it's really you.
The cranky old man on the CP.
I knew what you would be like.
Inconspicuous, dressed like a divorce bureaucrat.
Come, take a walk with me.
What if I don't want to?
Three close personal friends of the guy who fell off your roof last week have my house staked out.
Wouldn't you like to know why?
So come, walk with me already.
How did you know I would be on that train?
I am a very old, enormously talented spy, Ronnie.
I've been running agents since the year your mother learned to ride a bike.
I know how your mind works.
I know you better than you know yourself.
Yeah, but how did you really know?
You put a bug in your purse.
It reminds me, once you start getting your extra pay from my department, buy yourself some decent accessories.
Your idea of business clothes makes you look like a Sunday school teacher.
You pompous old Washington son of a…
They do plastic surgery research here.
So anyway, Kamal, how hard is it to flash clone somebody?
Hacking the CP probably is too.
I mean like child porn illegal, Aiden.
Let's say we wanted to flash clone a vid star, which I don't.
But let's just say we wanted to flash clone a vid star.
Let that finely tuned brain of yours begin to hum.
First we'd have to have access to the star's DNA.
And we throw in a facelift for free.
Aiden, what are we going to do with our clones when the original isn't famous anymore?
Have you thought about any of this stuff?
What I need is a feasibility study.
Tell me what we need to do.
You got me this job in the first place, didn't you?
You and that low down scheming Professor Avi, you set me up so you would have a pawn on the inside.
You think I don't have problems of my own?
In my day, we didn't complain when someone offered us a job.
I'm thinking I might quit and go home.
But I'm afraid y'all won't let me.
You're going to have to be a little brave, Ronnie.
I'm sorry about that, but the times don't give us many choices these days.
There's a young man up on an orbital platform tonight.
I really don't want you to know about him.
Ronnie, I have my enemies, but I have my friends, too.
Take a little comfort from that.
Go to work like nothing happens.
All I ask is that you keep your eyes open.
Remembering to keep them shut is the problem.
Oh, you love the steak here.
You can really taste the soy.
What do you mean it doesn't work?
Flash clones aren't just like rubber stamps of the original.
You take an embryo and develop it a hundred times faster than it would have naturally.
What you get is something different.
So we do plastic surgery to make them look great.
Hell, you could do that, couldn't you?
Aidan, all these anomalies pop up because flash clones are forced to go through time too fast.
Okay, flash clones don't know how to talk.
They walk down red carpets and show off their clothes.
Nobody wants to hear them talk.
Well, they don't know how to wave and smile either.
Clones don't have any muscle memory.
No training like you and I just got observing people while we were crowing.
We'll prop them up behind tables, put sunglasses on them and make them look arrogant and bored.
We'll make sure they've got managers with them.
Miss Popstar doesn't believe that this role fully realizes her artistic integrity.
Aidan Christ, will you listen to me?
You can train them intensive therapy, but after a year or two they start to degenerate.
That takes care of the problem of what to do with them afterwards, right?
About the time you might get them to be coherent, to talk and walk, all these little errors in their systems add up and you get a metabolic cascade failure.
Well, I'm headed to New York.
Ever been to Coney Island at night?
Thanks, but I should be getting back.
You know, we could kick around town, have some laughs, maybe get some good-
And I bet you're a really swell hell jumper.
And I'm flattered, you would ask.
Hey, cute girl on a train.
But I already have a boyfriend.
You don't give up easily, do you?
They pound the quit right out of us.
Hey, which reminds me, how did you-
Plus the campaign tattoos on your scalp and the gold comet logo on your bag.
Joe, I'm not talking to you anymore.
I am not a Sunday school teacher.
I thought you weren't talking to me.
Come on, your boyfriend will never know.
Joe, you think girls don't know what that untanned circle around your fourth finger means?
If some tart buys your line of sleeves, it's because she decided to, not because she was too dumb to notice you slipped your wedding ring off that morning.
And I should tell the guys in the unit that.
Go back to your wife and leave me alone.
The wife and I are separated.
Meaning she's not on this train?
But there were a lot of survivors on Reach for some reason.
She said, Joe, if I buy it, I want you to keep living.
Don't you believe I used to be good at picking up girls?
Joe, you were never good at picking up girls.
My boyfriend's up on one of the orbital platforms.
Your boy got called up, you shared a tearful goodbye.
He told you how he might never be coming back, and you gave it up for him.
He told you he would always remember you.
Oh, it wasn't like that at all.
I see those guys the day after, Ronnie.
Nick would never lie to me.
Lying doesn't look the same when you think you're gonna die.
When you think you're gonna die, you take what you can get, any way you can.
There will be no further talk before Harvard Square, Boston.
Come out with me tonight, Sunday School.
You still don't see it, do you?
I'm not the only soldier here.
You better take what you can get.
Did Aiden tell you about his father?
Aiden and I don't talk about his business.
Listen, if you need me to go home, I can go home.
Let me get you some water.
Lately, Aiden's been coming to me with his weekly scheme.
Well, he shows up two or three days ago saying he's got this great new idea.
He wants to clone pop stars.
Flash clones, that's kind of different for him.
You mean most of his ideas aren't felonious?
Well, they're not that blatant anyway.
I said I'd look into it just so I could explain to him why it couldn't be done.
I did explain it to him.
I was telling him, listen, these people, these clones, they can't walk, they can't talk, they always degenerate.
We never brought her home from the hospital, Sophie.
If that was a flash clone in my house, where was my sister?
Waiting for me to come and get her, Sophie.
Waiting for me to come and get her.
